intro: Orbexilum macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leaf orbexilum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for xeriscaping. Orbexilum macrophyllum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
